alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Essex, northeastern Suffolk and east central Middlesex Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Saugus, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Lynn, Malden, Revere, Peabody, Everett, Salem, Chelsea, Melrose, Saugus, Wakefield, Marblehead, Swampscott, Lynnfield and Nahant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
